content.text: (i) The price of the car is \(\$ 28\) 240 . She is given a \(7.5 \%\) discount.
Calculate the amount she pays.
(ii) The fuel tank in the new car has a capacity of 45 litres. This is \(72 \%\) of the capacity of the fuel tank in her old car.
Calculate the capacity of the fuel tank in her old car.
1 (a) Anvi buys a new car.
(b) Aadi buys a new car costing \(\$ 28000\). He pays for the car using a finance plan. The finance plan is

- a deposit
- 47 equal monthly payments of \(\$ 330\)
- a final payment of \(\$ 11490\).
Using this finance plan, Aadi pays a total of \(\$ 31900\) for the car.
Calculate the deposit paid as a percentage of \(\$ 28000\).
(c) A car travels 64 km and uses 2.5 litres of fuel. It then travels 128 km and uses 6 litres of fuel.
Calculate the rate at which the car uses fuel during the whole journey. Give your answer in litres per 100 km.
litres per 100 km
(d) At the start of 2021 the value of a car was \(\$ 46500\).
At the end of 2021 the value of the car was 20% less.
At the end of 2022 the value of the car was \(15 \%\) less than its value at the end of 2021.
Calculate the value of the car at the end of 2022.
(a) Complete the table.
(b) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=x^{3}+4 x^{2}-4\) for \(-4.5 \leqslant x \leqslant 1.5\).
(c) (i) Draw the tangent to the graph at the point \((1,1)\).
(ii) Use your tangent to estimate the gradient of the curve at the point \((1,1)\).
(d) By drawing a suitable straight line on the grid, solve the equation \(x^{3}+4 x^{2}-x-6=0\).
2 The table shows some values for \(y=x^{3}+4 x^{2}-4\).
3 (a) Simplify.
(b) This isosceles triangle has a perimeter of 35.5 cm .
Find the value of \(a\).
(c) Using the quadratic formula, solve \(5 x^{2}-4 x-3=0\).
You must show all your working.
(d) Solve these simultaneous equations.
You must show all your working.
4 (a) The angles of a quadrilateral are \(w^{\circ}, x^{\circ}, y^{\circ}\) and \(z^{\circ}\).
The ratio \(w:(x+y+z)=3:5\).
Find the value of \(w\).
(i) Find angle \(B A M\).
Angle \(B A M=\)

\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are points on a circle. \(P Q\) is the tangent to the circle at \(A\). \(B M N D\) is a straight line. Angle \(A C D=49^{\circ}\), angle \(A M B=105^{\circ}\) and angle \(P A B=45^{\circ}\).
(i) Show that angle \(A O C=108.12^{\circ}\), correct to 2 decimal places.
(ii) Calculate the length of the minor arc \(A B C\).
(iii) Calculate the area of the major sector OCDA .
\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are points on a circle, centre \(O\).
\(T A\) and \(T C\) are tangents to the circle.
\(O A=6.75 \mathrm{~cm}\) and \(O T=11.5 \mathrm{~cm}\).
(i) Use the cumulative frequency diagram to find an estimate for
(ii) One of these motorists is picked at random.
Find the probability that this motorist travels more than 1800 km .
5 (a) The cumulative frequency diagram shows information about the distance travelled by each of 80 motorists in a month.
(b) The distance around a racing track is 5.104 km .
The time taken by a car to complete one lap of the track is 1 min 18 s .
Calculate the average speed of the car. Give your answer in km /h .
(i) Show that there are 8 cars with a top speed in the interval \(120<v \leqslant 160\).
(ii) Calculate an estimate of the mean top speed. You must show all your working.
(c) The top speed, \(v \mathrm{~km} / \mathrm{h}\), of each of 160 cars is recorded. The histogram shows this information.
6 (a) Work out \(2\left(-\frac{3}{5}\right)-\left(-\frac{2}{7}\right)\).
(i) \(M\) is the point \((2,-5)\).
Find the coordinates of \(N\).
(ii) Find \(\left|\overrightarrow{M N}\right|\).
(b) \(\overrightarrow{M N}=\left(-\frac{6}{4}\right)\).
(i) Write each of the following in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\).
Give each answer in its simplest form.
\(O A C B\) is a trapezium with \(O B=2 A C\).
\(\overrightarrow{O A}=\mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{O B}=2 \mathbf{c}\).
\(A P:P B=4:1\) and \(A Q=\frac{4}{5} A C\).
(d) \(\overrightarrow{Q P}\)
(i) Show that angle \(C B D=81^{\circ}\).
(ii) Calculate \(C D\).
(iii) Show that angle \(A B D=31.6^{\circ}\), correct to 1 decimal place.
(iv) Find the shortest distance from \(A\) to \(B D\).
(v) Find the bearing of \(B\) from \(C\).
(vi) Trees are planted in the field.
The number of trees planted is 1100 per hectare.
Calculate the total number of trees planted in the field.
\([1 \mathrm{~hectare}=10000 \mathrm{~m}^{2}]\)
(b) A rectangle has an area of \(9400 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\), correct to the nearest \(100 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
The length of the rectangle is 80 cm , correct to the nearest 10 cm .
Calculate the upper bound of the width of the rectangle.
The diagram shows a field, \(A B C D\) with \(B\) north of \(A\).
\(B D\) is a path across the field.
\(A B=85 \mathrm{~m}, A D=72 \mathrm{~m}, B D=129 \mathrm{~m},\) angle \(B D C=39^{\circ}\) and angle \(B C D=60^{\circ}\).
(i) the bead is yellow
(ii) the bead is not yellow.
8 (a) A bag contains 24 coloured beads. Some are red, some are blue and 10 are yellow. One bead is picked at random from the bag.
Find the probability that
(i) the first marble is black and the second marble is white
(ii) both marbles have different colours.
(b) Another bag contains 5 green marbles, 6 white marbles and 4 black marbles.
Meera picks 2 marbles at random from the bag, without replacement.
Find the probability that
(ii) \(\mathrm{gf}(7)\)
(a) Find
(b) Find \(\mathrm{gf}(x)-3 \mathrm{~g}(x)\).
Give your answer in the form \(a x^{2}+b x+c\).
9 \(\quad f(x)=2 x-5 \quad g(x)=x^{2}-2 x\)
(a) Differentiate \(x^{3}-9 x^{2}-48 x\).
(b) Find the coordinates of the turning points of the graph of \(y=x^{3}-9 x^{2}-48 x\). You must show all your working.
(c) Determine whether each of the turning points is a maximum or a minimum.
Give reasons for your answers.
10 A curve has the equation \(y=x^{3}-9 x^{2}-48 x\).
